member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.AllocateHierarchy

member.summary: Forces an object to free resources before the object is destroyed by the Garbage Collector.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.AnimationController
member.summary: Controls animation functionality, connecting animation sets to the transformation frames being animated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.AnimationController.AdvanceTime(System.Double,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.HandleAnimationCallback)
member.summary: Animates the mesh and advances the global animation time by a specified amount.
member.param: [in] Amount, in seconds, by which to advance the global animation time. This value must be non-negative or 0.
[in] A HandleAnimationCallback user-defined animation callback handler.

[in] Maximum number of animation sets the controller can support.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of a class.
member.param: [in] Maximum number of matrices that can be animated.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.AnimationController.GetUpcomingPriorityBlend(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns an event handle to the next priority blend event scheduled to occur after a specified event.
member.param: [in] Event handle to the specified event. If set to 0, the method returns the next scheduled priority blend event.
member.returns: Event handle to the next scheduled priority blend event. If no new priority blend event is scheduled, a value of 0 is returned.

member.summary: Returns an event handle to the next event scheduled to occur after a specified event on an animation track.
member.param: [in] Track identifier.
[in] Event handle to the specified event. If set to 0, the method returns the next scheduled event.
member.returns: Event handle to the next event scheduled to run on the specified track. If no new event is scheduled, a value of 0 is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.AnimationController.KeyPriorityBlend(System.Single,System.Double,System.Double,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TransitionType)
member.summary: Sets blending event keys for the specified animation track.
member.param: [in] Number between 0 and 1 that is used to blend tracks.
[in] Global time at which to start the blend.
[in] Global time duration of the blend.
[in] Transition type used for the duration of the blend. For more information, see TransitionType.
member.returns: Handle to the priority blend event. If one or more of the input parameters is invalid, or if no free event is available, a value of 0 is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.AnimationController.KeyTrackEnable(System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets an event key that enables or disables an animation track.
member.param: [in] Identifier of the animation track to modify.
[in] Enable flag. Set to true to enable the animation track, or to false to disable it.
[in] Global time key that specifies the global time at which the change will occur.
member.returns: Priority blend event. If the track is invalid, a value of 0 is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.AnimationController.KeyTrackPosition(System.Int32,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets an event key that changes the local time of an animation track.
member.param: [in] Identifier of the track to modify.
[in] New local time of the animation track.
[in] Global time key that specifies the global time at which the change will occur.
member.returns: Priority blend event. If track is invalid, or if no free event is available, a value of 0 is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.AnimationController.KeyTrackSpeed(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Double,System.Double,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TransitionType)
member.summary: Sets an event key that changes the local time of an animation track.
member.param: [in] Identifier of the track to modify.
[in] New speed of the animation track.
[in] Global time key that specifies the global time at which the change will occur.
[in] Transition time, which specifies how long the smooth transition will take to complete.
[in] Transition type used for transitioning between speeds. For more information, see TransitionType.
member.returns: Event handle to the priority blend event. If one or more of the input parameters is invalid, or if no free event is available, a value of 0 is returned.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.AnimationController.KeyTrackWeight(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Double,System.Double,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TransitionType)
member.summary: Sets an event key that changes the weight of an animation track.
member.param: [in] Identifier of the track to modify.
[in] New weight of the track.
[in] Global time key that specifies the global time at which the change will occur.
[in] Transition time, which specifies how long the smooth transition will take to complete.
[in] Transition type used for transitioning between weights. For more information, see TransitionType.
member.returns: Event handle to the priority blend event. If one or more of the input parameters is invalid, or if no free event is available, a value of 0 is returned.

member.returns: Cloned mesh.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.BaseMesh.LockIndexBuffer(System.Type,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.LockFlags,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Locks an index buffer and obtains the index buffer data.
member.param: A Type object that indicates the type of array data to return. This can be a value type or any type that contains only value types.

[in] Combination of zero or more LockFlags that describe the type of lock to perform. For this method, the valid flags are Discard, NoDirtyUpdate, NoSystemLock, and ReadOnly. For a description of the flags, see LockFlags.
[in] Array of one to three Int32 values that indicate the dimensions of the returning Array.
member.returns: An Array that represents the locked index buffer.

member.returns: A GraphicsStream object that represents the locked index buffer.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of a class.

[in] Height of the font.
[in] Width of the font.
[in] Weight of the font.
[in] Number of mip levels.
[in] Value that indicates whether the font is in italics. If set to true, the font is italicized; if set to false, it is not.
[in] A CharacterSet enumerated value that indicates the type of characters to use.
[in] A Precision constant that indicates the font precision.
[in] A FontQuality value that indicates the quality of the font.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Font.DrawText(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Sprite,System.String,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Draws formatted text.
member.param:
[in] A Sprite object that contains the string. Can be null, in which case Microsoft Direct3D renders the string with its own sprite object.
If Font.DrawText will be called more than once in a row, a sprite object should be specified to improve efficiency.
[in] String to draw.
[in] A Rectangle structure that contains the rectangle, in logical coordinates, in which the text is being formatted.
[in] Method of formatting the text; can be any combination of values from the DrawTextFormat enumeration.
[in] Color of the text. For more information, see Color. Either this parameter or color must be specified, but not both.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the height of the text in logical units. If Center or Bottom is specified, the return value is the offset from the Rectangle.Top property to the bottom of the drawn text. If the function fails, the return value is 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Font.DrawText(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Sprite,System.String,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws formatted text.
member.param:
[in] A Sprite object that contains the string. Can be null, in which case Microsoft Direct3D renders the string with its own sprite object.
If Font.DrawText will be called more than once in a row, a sprite object should be specified to improve efficiency.
[in] String to draw.
[in] A Rectangle structure that contains the rectangle, in logical coordinates, in which the text is being formatted.
[in] Method of formatting the text; can be any combination of values from the DrawTextFormat enumeration.
[in] Integer color value. Either this value or color must be specified, but not both.
member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is the height of the text in logical units. If Center or Bottom is specified, the return value is the offset from the Rectangle.Top property to the bottom of the drawn text. If the function fails, the return value is 0.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Line.DrawTransform(Microsoft.DirectX.Vector3[],Microsoft.DirectX.Matrix,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Draws a line strip in screen space with a specified input transformation matrix.
member.param: [in] Array of vertices that make up the line. For more information, see Vector2.

[in] Scale, rotate, and translate (SRT) matrix for transforming the points. For more information, see Matrix. If this matrix is a projection matrix, any stippled lines are drawn with a perspective-correct stippling pattern. Or, vertices can be transformed and Line.Draw used to draw the line with a stipple pattern and no perspective correction.
[in] A Color object that specifies the color of the line.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Line.DrawTransform(Microsoft.DirectX.Vector3[],Microsoft.DirectX.Matrix,System.Int32)
member.summary: Draws a line strip in screen space with a specified input transformation matrix.
member.param: [in] Array of vertices that make up the line. For more information, see Vector2.

[in] Scale, rotate, and translate (SRT) matrix for transforming the points. For more information, see Matrix. If this matrix is a projection matrix, any stippled lines are drawn with a perspective-correct stippling pattern. Or, vertices can be transformed and Line.Draw used to draw the line with a stipple pattern and no perspective correction.
[in] An Int32 color value that specifies the color of the line.

member.summary: Cleans a mesh, preparing it for simplification.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.ComputeTangent(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes the tangent vectors for the texture coordinates given in a texture stage.
member.param: [in] Index that represents the TextureState in TextureStates.
[in] Index that provides the usage index for the tangent data. The vertex declaration implies the usage; this index modifies it.
[in] Index that provides the usage index for the binormal data. The vertex declaration implies the usage; this index modifies it.
[in] Value that is set to 0 to specify no wrapping, or to 1 to specify wrapping in the u and v directions.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.ComputeTangent(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.GraphicsStream)
member.summary: Computes the tangent vectors for the texture coordinates given in a texture stage.
member.param: [in] Index that represents the TextureState in TextureStates.
[in] Index that provides the usage index for the tangent data. The vertex declaration implies the usage; this index modifies it.
[in] Index that provides the usage index for the binormal data. The vertex declaration implies the usage; this index modifies it.
[in] Value that is set to 0 to specify no wrapping, or to 1 to specify wrapping in the u and v directions.
[in] A GraphicsStream object filled with an array of three Int32 values per face to be filled with adjacent face indices.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.ComputeTangent(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[])
member.summary: Computes the tangent vectors for the texture coordinates given in a texture stage.
member.param: [in] Index that represents the TextureState in TextureStates.
[in] Index that provides the usage index for the tangent data. The vertex declaration implies the usage; this index modifies it.
[in] Index that provides the usage index for the binormal data. The vertex declaration implies the usage; this index modifies it.
[in] Value that is set to 0 to specify no wrapping, or to 1 to specify wrapping in the u and v directions.
[in] Array of three Int32 values per face that specify the three neighbors for each face in the mesh. The size of this array must be at least 3 * BaseMesh.NumberFaces.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.ConvertMeshSubsetToSingleStrip(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh,System.Int32,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.MeshFlags,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Converts the specified mesh subset into a single triangle strip.
member.param: [in] A BaseMesh object that represents the mesh to convert.
[in] Attribute identifier of the mesh subset to convert.
[in] One or more flags from the MeshFlags enumeration that specify options for creating the single strip mesh (excepting the Simplify* and Optimize* flags).
[out] Number of indices in the buffer returned in the IndexBuffer.
member.returns: An IndexBuffer object that contains the strip.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.ConvertMeshSubsetToStrips(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.BaseMesh,System.Int32,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.MeshFlags,System.Int32@,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.GraphicsStream@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Converts the specified mesh subset into a series of strips.
member.param: [in] A BaseMesh interface that represents the mesh to convert.
[in] Attribute identifier of the mesh subset to convert.
[in] One or more flags from the MeshFlags enumeration that specify options for creating the new strip mesh (excepting the Simplify* and Optimize* flags).
[out] Number of indices in the buffer returned in the IndexBuffer.
[out] A GraphicsStream that contains one Int32 value per strip, which specifies the number of triangles in that strip.
[out] Number of individual strips in the index buffer and the corresponding strip length array.
member.returns: An IndexBuffer class that represents the index buffer containing the strip.

member.param: [in] A Device object that represents the device associated with the created cylinder mesh.

[in] Radius at the positive Z end. Value should be greater than or equal to 0.0f.
[in] Length of the cylinder along the z-axis.
[in] Number of slices around the main axis.
[in] Number of stacks along the main axis.
[out] A GraphicsStream object containing three Int32 values per face that specify the three neighbors for each face in the mesh.
member.returns: A Mesh object that represents the cylinder mesh.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.Dispose
member.summary: Immediately releases the unmanaged resources used by the current object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Returns a value that indicates whether the current instance is equal to a specified object.
member.param: Object with which to make the comparison.
member.returns: Value that is true if the instance is equal to the specified object; false if it is not.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.Finalize
member.summary: Called during garbage collection. If implemented, allows an object to free resources before it is destroyed by the garbage collector.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.FromFile(System.String,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.MeshFlags,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Device,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.EffectInstance@)
member.summary: Loads a mesh from a DirectX (.x) file.
member.param: [in] String that specifies the file name.
[in] One or more flags from the MeshFlags enumeration that specify creation options for the mesh (excepting the Simplify* and Optimize* flags).
[in] A Device object that represents the device associated with the mesh.

[out] An EffectInstance structure that contains a set of EffectDefault structures. Each EffectDefault represents an attribute group in the returned mesh. The data in these structures represent a particular instance of state information used to initialize an effect. For more information, see EffectInstance.
member.returns: [out] A Mesh object that represents the loaded mesh.

member.summary: Locks an attribute buffer and obtains its memory.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.Optimize(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.MeshFlags,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.GraphicsStream)
member.summary: Controls the reordering of mesh faces and vertices to optimize performance and generate an output mesh.
member.param: [in] Type of optimization to perform; can be set to one or more MeshFlags flags (except Use32Bit, IbWriteOnly, and WriteOnly).
[in] A GraphicsStream containing three Int32 values per face that specify the three neighbors for each face in the source mesh. If the edge has no adjacent faces, the value is 0.
member.returns: [out] A Mesh object that represents the optimized mesh.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.Optimize(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.MeshFlags,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.GraphicsStream,System.Int32[]@,System.Int32[]@,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.GraphicsStream@)
member.summary: Controls the reordering of mesh faces and vertices to optimize performance and generate an output mesh.
member.param: [in] Type of optimization to perform; can be set to one or more MeshFlags flags (except Use32Bit, IbWriteOnly, and WriteOnly).
[in] A GraphicsStream containing three Int32 values per face that specify the three neighbors for each face in the source mesh. If the edge has no adjacent faces, the value is 0.

[in, out] Array for the face adjacency array of the optimized mesh. The face adjacency is stored as an array of arrays. The innermost array is three indices of adjacent triangles, and the outermost array is one set of face adjacencies per triangle in the mesh.
[in, out] Destination buffer that contains the new index for each face.
[out] A GraphicsStream that contains the new index for each vertex.
member.returns: [out] A Mesh object that represents the optimized mesh.

member.summary: Tessellates the given mesh using the N-patch tessellation scheme.
member.param: [in] A Mesh object that represents the mesh to tessellate.
[in] A GraphicsStream containing three Int32 values per face that specify the three neighbors for each face in the source mesh.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.WeldVertices(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.WeldEpsilonsFlags,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.WeldEpsilons,System.Int32[],Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.GraphicsStream@)
member.summary: Welds together replicated vertices that have equal attributes.
member.param: [in] One or more flags from WeldEpsilonsFlags.
[in] A WeldEpsilons structure that specifies the epsilon values to use for this method.

[in] Array of three Int32 values per face that specify the three neighbors for each face in the source mesh. If the edge has no adjacent faces, the value is 0. If this parameter is omitted, BaseMesh.GenerateAdjacency is called to create logical adjacency information.
[out] A GraphicsStream object that contains the new index for each vertex.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.WeldVertices(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.WeldEpsilonsFlags,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.WeldEpsilons,System.Int32[])

[in] Array of three Int32 values per face that specify the three neighbors for each face in the source mesh. If the edge has no adjacent faces, the value is 0. If this parameter is omitted, BaseMesh.GenerateAdjacency is called to create logical adjacency information.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh.WeldVertices(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.WeldEpsilonsFlags,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.WeldEpsilons,System.Int32[],System.Int32[]@,System.Int32[]@,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.GraphicsStream@)
member.summary: Welds together replicated vertices that have equal attributes.
member.param: [in] One or more flags from WeldEpsilonsFlags.
[in] A WeldEpsilons structure that specifies the epsilon values to use for this method.

[in] Array of three Int32 values per face that specify the three neighbors for each face in the source mesh. If the edge has no adjacent faces, the value is 0. If this parameter is omitted, BaseMesh.GenerateAdjacency is called to create logical adjacency information.

[in, out] Face adjacency array of the optimized mesh. The face adjacency is stored as an array of arrays. The innermost array is three indices of adjacent triangles, and the outermost array is one set of face adjacencies per triangle in the mesh.
[out] Array that contains the new index for each face.
[out] A GraphicsStream object that contains the new index for each vertex.

[in, out] A GraphicsStream that contains the face adjacency array of the optimized mesh. The face adjacency is stored as an array of arrays. The innermost array is three indices of adjacent triangles, and the outer array is one set of face adjacencies per triangle in the mesh.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PatchMesh.Tessellate(System.Single,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh)
member.summary: Performs uniform tessellation based on the tessellation level.
member.param: [in] Tessellation level. This is the number of vertices introduced between existing vertices. The range of this floating-point parameter is between 0 and 32.
[in] Resulting tessellated mesh. For more information, see Mesh.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PatchMesh.TessellateAdaptive(Microsoft.DirectX.Vector4,System.Int32,System.Int32,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh)
member.summary: Performs adaptive tessellation based on the z-based adaptive tessellation criterion.
member.param: [in] Specifies a 4-D vector (Vector4) that is dotted with the vertices to get the per-vertex adaptive tessellation amount. Each edge is tessellated to the average value of the tessellation levels for the two vertices it connects.
[in] Maximum limit for adaptive tessellation. This is the number of vertices introduced between existing vertices. The range of this integer value is between minTessellate and 32.
[in] Minimum limit for adaptive tessellation. This is the number of vertices introduced between existing vertices. The range of this integer value is between 1 and maxTessellate.
[in] Resulting tessellated mesh. For more information, see Mesh.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ProgressiveMesh.#ctor(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Mesh,System.Int32[],System.Single[],System.Int32,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.MeshFlags)

[in] Array of vertex weights. If this parameter is omitted, all vertex weights are set to 1.0. Note that the higher the vertex weight for a given vertex, the less likely it is to be simplified out of existence.

[in] Simplification options for the mesh. Either SimplifyFace or SimplifyVertex can be set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ProgressiveMesh.Optimize(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.MeshFlags)
member.summary: Generates an output mesh with reordered faces and vertices to optimize performance.
member.param: [in] Type of optimization to perform. This parameter can be set to one or more flags from MeshFlags (except Use32Bit, WriteOnly, IbWriteOnly, SimplifyFace, or SimplifyVertex).
member.returns: A Mesh object that represents the optimized mesh.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ProgressiveMesh.Optimize(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.MeshFlags,System.Int32[]@,System.Int32[]@)
member.summary: Generates an output mesh with reordered faces and vertices to optimize performance.
member.param: [in] Type of optimization to perform. This parameter can be set to one or more flags from MeshFlags (except Use32Bit, WriteOnly, IbWriteOnly, SimplifyFace, or SimplifyVertex).

[out] Array for the face adjacency array of the optimized mesh. The face adjacency is stored as an array of arrays. The innermost array is three indices of adjacent triangles, and the outermost array is one set of face adjacencies per triangle in the mesh. The size of this array is the maximum number of faces multiplied by 3.
[out] Array that contains the new index for each face.
member.returns: A Mesh object that represents the optimized mesh.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ProgressiveMesh.Optimize(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.MeshFlags,System.Int32[]@,System.Int32[]@,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.GraphicsStream@)
member.summary: Generates an output mesh with reordered faces and vertices to optimize performance.
member.param: [in] Type of optimization to perform. This parameter can be set to one or more flags from MeshFlags (except Use32Bit, WriteOnly, IbWriteOnly, SimplifyFace, or SimplifyVertex).

[out] Array for the face adjacency array of the optimized mesh. The face adjacency is stored as an array of arrays. The innermost array is three indices of adjacent triangles, and the outermost array is one set of face adjacencies per triangle in the mesh. The size of this array is the maximum number of faces multiplied by 3.
[out] Array that contains the new index for each face.
A GraphicsStream object that contains the new index for each vertex.
member.returns: A Mesh object that represents the optimized mesh.

member.summary: Prepares a device for drawing sprites.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: [in] Reference to an instance of a Device object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Sprite.Dispose
member.summary: Immediately releases the unmanaged resources used by an object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Sprite.Draw(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Texture,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Microsoft.DirectX.Vector3,Microsoft.DirectX.Vector3,System.Drawing.Color)
member.summary: Adds a sprite to the list of batched sprites.
member.param: [in] A Texture object that represents the sprite texture.
[in] A Rectangle object that indicates the portion of the source texture to use for the sprite. If this argument is 0, the entire source image is used for the sprite.
[in] A Vector3 structure that identifies the center of the sprite. If this argument is zero, the point (0,0,0), the upper-left corner, is used.
[in] A Vector3 structure that identifies the position of the sprite. If this argument is 0, the point (0,0,0), the upper-left corner, is used.
[in] A Color structure. The color and alpha channels are modulated by this value. A value of 0xFFFFFFFF maintains the original source color and alpha data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Sprite.Draw(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Texture,System.Drawing.Rectangle,Microsoft.DirectX.Vector3,Microsoft.DirectX.Vector3,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a sprite to the list of batched sprites.
member.param: [in] A Texture object that represents the sprite texture.
[in] A Rectangle object that indicates the portion of the source texture to use for the sprite. If this argument is 0, the entire source image is used for the sprite.
[in] A Vector3 structure that identifies the center of the sprite. If this argument is zero, the point (0,0,0), the upper-left corner, is used.
[in] A Vector3 structure that identifies the position of the sprite. If this argument is 0, the point (0,0,0), the upper-left corner, is used.
[in] Color value represented as an integer. The color and alpha channels are modulated by this value. A value of 0xFFFFFFFF maintains the original source color and alpha data.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Sprite.SetWorldViewLH(Microsoft.DirectX.Matrix,Microsoft.DirectX.Matrix)
member.summary: Sets the left-handed world-view transform for a sprite. A call to this method is required before 2-D technique of simulating the appearance of a 3-D object in a scene. An application inserts a primitive, typically rectangular, into the scene, orients it so that one face is toward the viewer, and applies a texture or a set of textures. The texture or set of textures gives the appearance of an animated 3-D object. or sorting sprites.
member.param: [in] A Matrix object that contains a world transform.
[in] A Matrix object that contains a view transform.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Sprite.SetWorldViewRH(Microsoft.DirectX.Matrix,Microsoft.DirectX.Matrix)
member.summary: Sets the right-handed world-view transform for a sprite. A call to this method is required before 2-D technique of simulating the appearance of a 3-D object in a scene. An application inserts a primitive, typically rectangular, into the scene, orients it so that one face is toward the viewer, and applies a texture or a set of textures. The texture or set of textures gives the appearance of an animated 3-D object. or sorting sprites.
member.param: [in] A Matrix object that contains a world transform.
[in] A Matrix object that contains a view transform.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureLoader
member.summary: Contains functions to load and save textures.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureLoader.CheckCubeTextureRequirements(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Device,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Usage,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Pool,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.CubeTextureRequirements@)
member.summary: Checks creation parameters for a cube texture.
member.param: [in] A Device class that represents the device to associate with the cube texture.

[in] Value that is either 0 or Usage.RenderTarget. Setting this flag to Usage.RenderTarget indicates that the surface will be used as a render target. The resource can then be passed to the renderTarget parameter of the Device.SetRenderTarget method. If Usage.RenderTarget is specified, the application should determine whether the device supports this operation by calling Manager.CheckDeviceFormat.
[in] Member of the Pool enumerated type that describes the memory class into which the texture should be placed.
[out] A CubeTextureRequirements structure that contains the cube texture creation parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureLoader.CheckTextureRequirements(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Device,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Usage,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Pool,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureRequirements@)
member.summary: Checks creation parameters for a texture.
member.param: [in] A Device object that represents the device to associate with the texture.

[in] Value that is either 0 or Usage.RenderTarget. Setting this flag to Usage.RenderTarget indicates that the surface will be used as a render target. The resource can then be passed to the renderTarget parameter of the Device.SetRenderTarget method. If Usage.RenderTarget is specified, the application should determine whether the device supports this operation by calling Manager.CheckDeviceFormat.
[in] Member of the Pool enumerated type that describes the memory class into which the texture should be placed.
[out] A TextureRequirements structure that contains the texture creation parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureLoader.CheckVolumeTextureRequirements(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Device,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Pool,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VolumeTextureRequirements@)

member.param: [in] A Device object that represents the device to associate with the volume texture.
[in] Member of the Pool enumerated type that describes the memory class into which the texture should be placed.
[out] A VolumeTextureRequirements structure that contains the volume texture creation parameters.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureLoader.ComputeNormalMap(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Texture,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Texture,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.NormalMap,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Channel,System.Single)
member.summary: Converts a height map into a normal map.
member.param: [out] A Texture object that represents the destination texture.
[in] A Texture object that represents the source height-map texture.
[in] One or more NormalMap flags that indicate creation options.
[in] A Channel flag that specifies the source of the height information.
[in] Constant value by which the height information is multiplied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureLoader.ComputeNormalMap(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Texture,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Texture,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PaletteEntry[]@,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.NormalMap,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Channel,System.Single)
member.summary: Converts a height map into a normal map.
member.param: [out] A Texture object that represents the destination texture.
[in] A Texture object that represents the source height-map texture.
[out] Array of PaletteEntry structures containing a 256-color palette that represents the mapped normals.
[in] One or more NormalMap flags that indicate creation options.
[in] A Channel flag that specifies the source of the height information.
[in] Constant value by which the height information is multiplied.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureLoader.FillTexture(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VolumeTexture,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.GraphicsStream,Microsoft.DirectX.Vector4[])
member.summary: Uses a user-provided function or a compiled high-level shader language (HLSL) function to fill each texel of each mip level of a given texture.
member.param: [out] A VolumeTexture object that represents the filled texture.

[in] A GraphicsStream object that contains the compiled HLSL function. This can be created using ShaderLoader.CompileShader, ShaderLoader.CompileShaderFromStream, or ShaderLoader.CompileShaderFromFile.
[in] Array of constants, provided by the application from the constant table. This value can be 0. For more information, see Vector4.

[in] Array of constants, provided by the application from the constant table. This value can be 0. For more information, see Vector4.

member.summary: Uses a user-provided function or a compiled high-level shader language (HLSL) function to fill each texel of each mip level of a given texture.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureLoader.FilterTexture(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.BaseTexture,System.Int32,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter)
member.summary: Filters mipmap levels of a texture.
member.param: [in] A BaseTexture object that represents the texture object to filter.
[in] Level whose image is used to generate subsequent levels. A common value for this parameter is 0.
[in] One or more Filter values that control how the mipmap is filtered.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TextureLoader.FilterTexture(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.BaseTexture,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PaletteEntry[]@,System.Int32,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter)
member.summary: Filters mipmap levels of a texture.
member.param: [in] A BaseTexture object that represents the texture object to filter.

[out] Array of PaletteEntry structures that represent a 256-color palette to fill in. For formats that are not palletized, use 0. If a palette is not specified, the default Microsoft Direct3D palette (an all-opaque white palette) is provided. See Remarks.
[in] Level whose image is used to generate subsequent levels. A common value for this parameter is 0.
[in] One or more Filter values that control how the mipmap is filtered.

member.summary: Creates a cube texture from a file.
member.param: [in] A Device object that represents the device to associate with the cube texture.
[in] String that specifies the file name.
[in] Width and height of the cube texture, in pixels. For example, if the cube texture is an 8-pixel by 8-pixel cube, the value is 8. If the value is 0, the dimensions are taken from the file.
[in] Number of mip levels requested. If this value is 0, a complete mipmap chain is created.

[in] Zero or Usage.RenderTarget, or Usage.Dynamic. Setting this flag to Usage.RenderTarget indicates that the surface should be used as a render target. The resource can then be passed to the renderTarget parameter of the Device.SetRenderTarget method. If Usage.RenderTarget is specified, the application should determine whether the device supports this operation by calling Manager.CheckDeviceFormat. The Usage.Dynamic value indicates that the surface should be handled dynamically.

[in] Member of the Format enumerated type that describes the requested pixel format for the cube texture. The returned cube texture might have a different format from that specified by format. Applications should check the format of the returned cube texture. If format is Unknown, the format is taken from the file.
[in] Member of the Pool enumerated type that describes the memory class into which the cube texture should be placed.
[in] One or more Filter flags that control how the image is filtered.
[in] One or more Filter flags that control how the mipmaps are filtered.

[in] An Int32 value to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable the color key. This is always a 32-bit ARGB color that is independent of the source image format. Alpha is significant, and usually should be set to FF for opaque color keys. For example, for opaque black, the value equals 0xFF000000.
member.returns: [out] A CubeTexture object that represents the created cube texture object.

[in] Number of mip levels requested. If this value is 0, a complete mipmap chain is created.

[in] Zero or Usage.RenderTarget, or Usage.Dynamic. Setting this flag to Usage.RenderTarget indicates that the surface should be used as a render target. The resource can then be passed to the renderTarget parameter of the Device.SetRenderTarget method. If Usage.RenderTarget is specified, the application should determine whether the device supports this operation by calling Manager.CheckDeviceFormat. The Usage.Dynamic value indicates that the surface should be handled dynamically.

[in] Member of the Format enumerated type that describes the requested pixel format for the cube texture. The returned cube texture might have a different format from that specified by format. Applications should check the format of the returned cube texture. If format is Unknown, the format is taken from the file.
[in] Member of the Pool enumerated type that describes the memory class into which the cube texture should be placed.
[in] One or more Filter flags that control how the image is filtered.
[in] One or more Filter flags that control how the mipmaps are filtered.

[in] An Int32 value to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable the color key. The color key is always a 32-bit ARGB color that is independent of the source image format. Alpha is significant, and usually should be set to FF for opaque color keys. For example, for opaque black, the value equals 0xFF000000.
[out] Array of PaletteEntry structures that represent a 256-color palette to fill in, or 0.
member.returns: [out] A CubeTexture object that represents the created cube texture object.

[in] Zero or Usage.RenderTarget, or Usage.Dynamic. Setting this flag to Usage.RenderTarget indicates that the surface will used as a render target. The resource can then be passed to the renderTarget parameter of the Device.SetRenderTarget method. If Usage.RenderTarget is specified, the application should determine whether the device supports this operation by calling Manager.CheckDeviceFormat. The Usage.Dynamic value indicates that the surface should be handled dynamically.

[in] Member of the Format enumerated type that describes the requested pixel format for the cube texture. The returned cube texture might have a different format from that specified by format. Applications should check the format of the returned cube texture. If format is Unknown, the format is taken from the file.
[in] Member of the Pool enumerated type that describes the memory class into which the cube texture should be placed.
[in] One or more Filter flags that control how the image is filtered.
[in] One or more Filter flags that control how the mipmaps are filtered.

[in] An Int32 value to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable the color key. This is always a 32-bit ARGB color that is independent of the source image format. Alpha is significant, and usually should be set to FF for opaque color keys. For example, for opaque black, the value is equal to 0xFF000000.
[out] Array of PaletteEntry structures that represent a 256-color palette to fill in, or 0.
member.returns: [out] Address of a pointer to a VolumeTexture object that represents the created texture object.

member.param: [out] A Volume object that specifies the destination volume.
[out] Array of PaletteEntry structures that represent a 256-color palette to fill in, or 0.
[in] A Stream that contains the source volume texture in memory.
[in] Size of the file in memory, in bytes.
[in] One or more Filter flags that control how the image is filtered.

[in] An Int32 value to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable the color key. This is always a 32-bit ARGB color that is independent of the source image format. Alpha is significant, and usually should be set to FF for opaque color keys. For example, for opaque black, the value is equal to 0xFF000000.

member.name: M:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.VolumeLoader.FromStream(Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Volume,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PaletteEntry[]@,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Box,System.IO.Stream,System.Int32,Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a volume from a file in memory.
member.param: [out] A Volume object that specifies the destination volume.

[in] Size of the file in memory, in bytes.
[in] One or more Filter flags that control how the image is filtered.

[in] An Int32 value to replace with transparent black, or 0 to disable the color key. This is always a 32-bit ARGB color that is independent of the source image format. Alpha is significant, and usually should be set to FF for opaque color keys. For example, for opaque black, the value is equal to 0xFF000000.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat
member.summary: Specifies the method of formatting text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.WordEllipsis
member.summary: Truncates any word that does not fit in the rectangle and adds ellipses. Compare with and .

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.WordBreak
member.summary: Breaks words. Lines are automatically broken between words if a word extends past the edge of the rectangle specified by the parameter. A carriage return/line feed sequence also breaks the line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.VerticalCenter
member.summary: Centers text vertically (on a single line only).

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.TabStop
member.summary: Sets tab stops. Bits 15-8 (high-order byte of the low-order word) of the parameter specify the number of characters for each tab. The default number of characters per tab is eight. The , , , , and values cannot be used with the value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.SingleLine
member.summary: Displays text on a single line only. Carriage returns and line feeds do not break the line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.RightToLeftReading
member.summary: Displays text in right-to-left reading order for bidirectional text when a Hebrew or Arabic font is selected. The default reading order for all text is left-to-right.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.PrefixOnly
member.summary: MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows 2000Windows 2000/MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows XPWindows XP: Draws only an underline at the position of the character that follows the ampersand (&) prefix character. Does not draw any other characters in the string. For example, the input string "A&bc&&d" becomes " _ ". Compare with and .

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.NoPrefix
member.summary: Turns off processing of prefix characters. Typically, interprets the mnemonic-prefix character & as a directive to underscore the character that follows, and the mnemonic-prefix characters && as a directive to print a single &. By specifying , this processing is turned off. For example, the input string "A&bc&&d" remains "A&bc&&d". Compare with and .

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.NoFullWidthCharBreak
member.summary: MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows 98/MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows Millennium Edition (Windows Me)Windows Me, MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows 2000Windows 2000/MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows XPWindows XP: Prevents a line break at a double-byte character set (DBCS)DBCS string, so that the line-breaking rule is equivalent to single-byte character set (SBCS)SBCS strings. For example, this option can be used in Korean versions of Windows, for greater readability of icon labels. This value has no effect unless is specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.NoClip
member.summary: Draws without clipping. . is somewhat faster when is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.ModifyString
member.summary: Modifies the specified string to match the displayed text. This value has no effect unless or is specified.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.Internal
member.summary: Uses the system font to calculate text metrics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.HidePrefix
member.summary: MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows 2000Windows 2000/MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows XPWindows XP: Ignores the ampersand (&) prefix character in the text. The letter that follows it is not underlined, but other mnemonic-prefix characters are still processed. For example, the input string "A&bc&&d" becomes "Abc&d". Compare with and .

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.ExternalLeading
member.summary: Includes the font external leading in line height. Typically, external leading is not included in the height of a line of text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.ExpandTabs
member.summary: Expands tab characters. The default number of characters per tab is eight. The and values cannot be used with the value.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.PathEllipsis
member.summary: For displayed text, replaces characters in the middle of the string with ellipses so that the result fits in the specified rectangle. If the string contains backslash (\) characters, preserves as much as possible of the text after the last backslash. The string is not modified unless the flag is specified. Compare with and .

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.EndEllipsis
member.summary: For displayed text, truncates the end of a string and adds ellipses so that the result fits in the specified rectangle. If a word that is not at the end of the string goes beyond the limits of the rectangle, it is truncated without ellipses. The string is not modified unless the flag is specified. Compare with and .

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.EditControl
member.summary: Duplicates the text-displaying characteristics of a multi-line edit control. Specifically, the average character width is calculated in the same manner as for an edit control, and the function does not display a partially visible last line.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.Center
member.summary: Centers text horizontally in the rectangle.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.CalculateRect
member.summary: Determines the width and height of the rectangle. If there are multiple lines of text, . uses the width of the rectangle pointed to by the parameter and extends the base of the rectangle to bound the last line of text. If there is only one line of text, modifies the right side of the rectangle so that it bounds the last character in the line. In either case, . returns the height of the formatted text but does not draw the text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.Top
member.summary: Top-justifies text (on a single line only).

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.Right
member.summary: Aligns text to right.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.Left
member.summary: Aligns text to left.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.Bottom
member.summary: Justifies text to the bottom of the rectangle. This value must be combined with .

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.DrawTextFormat.None
member.summary: Specifies no formatting.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter
member.summary: Defines texture filtering modes for a texture stage. Each valid filter must contain exactly one of the following flags: None, Point, Linear, Triangle, or Box. In addition, the bitwise OR operator can be used to specify zero or more of the following optional flags with a valid filter: MirrorU, MirrorV, MirrorW, Mirror, or Dither.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.Box
member.summary: Each pixel is computed by averaging a 2x2(x2) box of pixels from the source image. This filter works only when the dimensions of the destination are half those of the source, as is the case with Also known as MIP map (Latin: multum in parvo, translated as "much in little"). A sequence of textures, each of which is a progressively lower-resolution, prefiltered representation of the same image. A higher-resolution image is used when a visible object is close to the viewer. As the object moves farther away (and gets smaller), lower-resolution images are used..

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.Point
member.summary: Each destination pixel is computed by sampling the nearest pixel from the source image.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.Srgb
member.summary: Same as specifying | .

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.SrgbOut
member.summary: Output data is in Standard color space that enables various devices including cameras, scanners, displays, and printers to produce reasonably identical colors. Optimized for 8 bits per channel with a gamma of 2.2, white point of D65, and primaries identical to HDTV/ITU-R BT.709/5. (gamma 2.2) color space.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.SrgbIn
member.summary: Input data is in Standard color space that enables various devices including cameras, scanners, displays, and printers to produce reasonably identical colors. Optimized for 8 bits per channel with a gamma of 2.2, white point of D65, and primaries identical to HDTV/ITU-R BT.709/5. (gamma 2.2) color space.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.DitherDiffusion
member.summary: Resulting image must be dithered using a 4x4 ordered dither algorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.Dither
member.summary: Resulting image must be dithered using a 4x4 ordered Method to display a range of colors with a limited palette. Each pixel on the source image is represented by multiple pixels (usually a 2x2 square) on the destination image. From a distance, the eye blends the multiple pixels into one color that has more shades than the original palette. The technique results in a better visual appearance than the removal of low precision bits. See a standard graphics reference for details. Dithering is a supported option by DXSurface and objects. algorithm.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.Mirror
member.summary: Same as specifying the , , and flags. This flag is always used internally for this function.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.MirrorW
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the w-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.MirrorV
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the v-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.MirrorU
member.summary: Pixels off the edge of the texture on the u-axis should be mirrored, not wrapped.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.Triangle
member.summary: Each pixel in the source image contributes equally to the destination image. This is the slowest of the filters.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.Linear
member.summary: Method used to map a source image to a target image. This method uses the weighted average of the four nearest source pixels to define a target pixel. interpolation filtering is used as a texture magnification or minification filter. A weighted average of a 2x2 area of texels surrounding the desired pixel is used. The texture filter to use between mipmap levels is trilinear mipmap interpolation. The rasterizer interpolates pixel color in a linear manner, using the texels of the two nearest textures.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Filter.None
member.summary: Mipmapping disabled. The rasterizer uses the magnification filter instead.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality
member.summary: Specifies the level of font quality. In MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows XPWindows XP, the following situations do not support MicrosoftMicrosoft ClearTypeClearType antialiasing: Text rendered on a printer.A display set for 256 colors or less.Text rendered on a Terminal Server client.The font is not a TrueTypeTrueType font or an OpenType font with TrueTypeTrueType outlines. For example, the following do not support MicrosoftMicrosoft ClearTypeClearType antialiasing: Type 1 fonts, Postscript OpenType fonts without TrueType outlines, bitmap fonts, vector fonts, and device fonts.The font has tuned embedded bitmaps only for the font sizes that contain the embedded bitmaps. For example, this occurs commonly in East Asian fonts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.ClearTypeNatural
member.summary: Text is rendered using the MicrosoftMicrosoft ClearTypeClearType antialiasing (smoothing) method when possible. The font quality is given more importance than maintaining the text size; thus, the text width can change. When using this mode for measuring and rendering, ensure that the application does not cache any layout information. If it does, remote users who do not have MicrosoftMicrosoft ClearTypeClearType enabled will view different width and metrics.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.ClearType
member.summary: MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows XPWindows XP: Text is rendered using the MicrosoftMicrosoft ClearTypeClearType antialiasing method when possible. The font quality is given less importance than maintaining the text size.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.AntiAliased
member.summary: MicrosoftMicrosoft Windows NTWindows NT 4.0 and later: Font is antialiased, if it supports antialiasing and if its size falls within the accepted range.MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows 95 with MicrosoftMicrosoft Plus!Plus!, MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows 98/MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows Millennium Edition (Windows Me)Windows Me: The display must be greater than 8-bit color, must be a single plane device, cannot be a palette display, and cannot be part of a multiple-display monitor setup. In addition, a TrueTypeTrueType font must be selected into a screen Data structure that defines the graphic objects, their associated attributes, and the graphic modes affecting output on a device. before it is used in a DIBSection (a structure that contains information about a device-independent bitmap); otherwise, antialiasing does not occur.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.NonAntiAliased
member.summary: MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows 95 with MicrosoftMicrosoft Plus!Plus!, MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows 98/MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows Millennium Edition (Windows Me)Windows Me, MicrosoftMicrosoft Windows NTWindows NT 4.0 and later: Font is never antialiased.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.Proof
member.summary: Font's character quality is given more importance than exact matching of the logical-font attributes. For MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows Graphics Device Interface (GDI)GDI raster fonts, scaling is disabled and the font closest in size is chosen. Although this size might not correspond exactly when is used, the font's quality is high and its appearance is not distorted. Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized if necessary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.Draft
member.summary: Font's appearance is given less importance than when the value is used. Scaling is enabled for MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows Graphics Device Interface (GDI)GDI raster fonts, which means that more font sizes are available, but their quality might be lower. Bold, italic, underline, and strikeout fonts are synthesized if necessary.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.FontQuality.Default
member.summary: Font's appearance does not matter.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.MeshFlags

member.summary: Simplifies the mesh by the number of faces specified in the minValue parameter of the method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.NormalMap.ComputeOcclusion
member.summary: Computes the per-pixel occlusion term and encodes it into the alpha. An alpha of 1 means that the pixel is not obscured in any way; an alpha of 0 means that the pixel is completely obscured.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily
member.summary: Defines font families.A font family is a set of fonts that have common stroke width and serif characteristics. There are five font families; a sixth family allows an application to use the default font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FamilyDecorative
member.summary: Specifies a novelty font; for example, Old English.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FamilyScript
member.summary: Specifies a font that is designed to look like handwriting; for example, Script and Cursive.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FamilyModern
member.summary: Specifies a monospace font with or without serifs. Monospace fonts are usually modern; examples include Pica, Elite, and Courier New.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FamilySwiss
member.summary: Specifies a proportional font without serifs; for example, Arial.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FamilyRoman
member.summary: Specifies a proportional font with serifs; for example, Times New Roman.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FamilyDoNotCare
member.summary: Specifies a generic family name, which is used when information about a font does not exist or does not matter. The default font is used.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.MonoFont
member.summary: Specifies a monospace font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.VariablePitch
member.summary: Specifies a variable-pitch font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.FixedPitch
member.summary: Specifies a fixed-pitch font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PitchAndFamily.DefaultPitch
member.summary: Specifies default pitch.

member.summary: Defines the type of looping mode to use for playback of an animation set.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PlaybackType.PingPong
member.summary: Animation alternates endlessly between playing forward and playing backward.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PlaybackType.Once
member.summary: Animation plays once, then stops on the last frame.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PlaybackType.Loop
member.summary: Animation repeats endlessly.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision
member.summary: Specifies the desired output precision. The output precision defines how closely the output must match the requested fonts height, width, character orientation, escapement, and pitch.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.Device
member.summary: When more than one font has a given name, use the device font if available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.PsOnly
member.summary: MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows 2000Windows 2000/MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows XP: When more than one font has a given name, choose a PostScript font if available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.ScreenOutline
member.summary: Specifies an outline-based screen font.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.Outline
member.summary: MicrosoftMicrosoft Windows NTWindows NT/MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows 2000Windows 2000/MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows XP: This value instructs the font mapper to choose from TrueType and other outline-based fonts.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.TtOnly
member.summary: MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows 2000Windows 2000/MicrosoftMicrosoft WindowsWindows XP: When more than one font has a given name, use the TrueTypeTrueType font if available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.Raster
member.summary: When more than one font has a given name, use the raster font if available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.Tt
member.summary: When more than one font has a given name, use the TrueTypeTrueType font if available.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.Stroke
member.summary: Specifies a font with attributes that exactly match the requested attributes.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.Character
member.summary: Specifies the font with a size (height and width) that most closely matches the requested size. The driver may disregard the requested orientation, but other attributes must match.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.String
member.summary: Specifies a font with a size (height and width) that most closely matches the requested size. The driver may disregard the requested orientation and escapement, but other attributes must match.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.Precision.Default
member.summary: Specifies any reasonable font.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PriorityType
member.summary: Defines the priority type an animation track is assigned to. Tracks with the same priority are blended together, and the two resulting values are then blended using the priority blend factor.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PriorityType.High
member.summary: Blends the track with all high-priority tracks before the high-priority blend is mixed with the low-priority blend.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.PriorityType.Low
member.summary: Blends the track with all low-priority tracks before the low-priority blend is mixed with the high-priority blend.

member.summary: Defines the compiler options to use during a shader compilation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShaderFlags.Debug
member.summary: Inserts debug file name and line number information during compilation.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShaderFlags.ForcePixelShaderSoftwareNoOptimizations
member.summary: Instructs the compiler to use software pixel shaders.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShaderFlags.ForceVertexShaderSoftwareNoOptimizations
member.summary: Instructs the compiler to use software vertex shaders.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShaderFlags.PartialPrecision
member.summary: Indicates to the device that the operation can be performed and the result stored at a lower precision (at least s10e5).

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShaderFlags.PackMatrixColumnMajor
member.summary: Instructs the compiler to pack matrices in column major order (that is, each vector in a single column).

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShaderFlags.PackMatrixRowMajor
member.summary: Instructs the compiler to pack matrices in row major order (that is, each vector in a single row).

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShaderFlags.SkipOptimization
member.summary: Instructs the compiler to skip optimization steps during code generation. This option is valid only when calling .; it is not recommended unless you are trying to isolate a code problem that you suspect originates in the compiler.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShaderFlags.SkipValidation
member.summary: Prevents the compiler from validating the generated code against known capabilities and constraints. This option is recommended only when compiling shaders that are known to work (that is, those that have compiled before without this option). Shaders are always validated before they are set to the device.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.ShaderFlags.None
member.summary: Instructs the compiler to use no options during compilation. Value resolves to 0.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags
member.summary: Defines flags used to specify sprite rendering options.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.AlphaBlend
member.summary: Enables alpha blending with . set to true (for nonzero alpha). is the source blend state, and is the destination blend state in calls to . The class requires this flag to be set when drawing text.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.SortDepthBackToFront
member.summary: Sorts sprites by depth in back-to-front order prior to drawing. This option is recommended when drawing transparent sprites of varying depths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.SortDepthFrontToBack
member.summary: Sorts sprites by depth in front-to-back order prior to drawing. This option is recommended when drawing opaque sprites of varying depths.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.SortTexture
member.summary: Sorts sprites by texture prior to drawing. This option is recommended when drawing non-overlapping sprites of uniform depth; for example, drawing screen-aligned text with .

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.Billboard
member.summary: Rotates each sprite around its center so that it is facing the viewer. . or . must be called first.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.ObjectSpace
member.summary: Specifies no modification of the world, view, and projection transforms. The transforms currently set to the device are used to transform sprites when the batched sprites are drawn (that is, when . or . is called). If this option is not specified, the world, view, and projection transforms are modified so that sprites are drawn in screen-space coordinates.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.DoNotModifyRenderState
member.summary: Specifies no changes to the device render state when . is called. The device is assumed to be in a valid state to draw vertices when the . property equals 0 and . is set to , , or .

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.DoNotSaveState
member.summary: Prevents the device state from being saved or restored when . or . is called.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.SpriteFlags.None
member.summary: Resolves the value to 0.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TransitionType
member.summary: Defines the transition style between values of a mesh animation. The calculation for the ramp from ease-in to ease-out is calculated as follows.Q(t) = 2(x - y)t3 + 3(y - x)t2 + x.where the ramp is a function Q(t) with the following properties:Q(t) is a cubic spline.Q(t) interpolates between x and y as t ranges from 0 to 1.Q(t) is horizontal when t = 0 and t = 1.Mathematically, this translates into:Q(t) = At3 + Bt2 + Ct + D (and therefore, Q'(t) = 3At2 + 2Bt + C)2a) Q(0) = x2b) Q(1) = y3a) Q'(0) = 03b) Q'(1) = 0Solving for A, B, C, D:D = x (from 2a)C = 0 (from 3a)3A + 2B = 0 (from 3b)A + B = y - x (from 2b and D = x)Therefore:A = 2(x - y), B = 3(y - x), C = 0, D = x.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TransitionType.EaseInEaseOut
member.summary: Ease-in, ease-out spline transition between values.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.TransitionType.Linear
member.summary: Linear transition between values.

member.name: T:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.WeldEpsilonsFlags
member.summary: Defines the options for welding vertices together. This enumeration is used with the . method.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.WeldEpsilonsFlags.DoNotSplit
member.summary: Instructs the weld to allow vertices to be modified only, not removed. This flag is valid only if is set. It is useful to modify vertices so that they are equal, but not to allow vertices to be removed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.WeldEpsilonsFlags.DoNotRemoveVertices
member.summary: Instructs the weld to allow vertices to be modified only, not removed. This flag is valid only if is set. It is useful to modify vertices to be equal, but not to allow vertices to be removed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.WeldEpsilonsFlags.WeldPartialMatches
member.summary: If a given vertex component is within epsilon, instructs the weld to modify partially matched vertices so that both components are equal. If all components are equal, one of the vertices is removed.

member.name: F:Microsoft.DirectX.Direct3D.WeldEpsilonsFlags.WeldAll
member.summary: Welds all vertices that are marked by adjacency as being overlapping.
